body: For posterity @kchibisov, can you provide some explanation (or link some issues) about why `OSC 52` is a security issue, and how `OSC 7` is annoying? I think I personally understand the former, but not necessarily the latter.

I'm not saying that `OSC 52` is security issue myself, but literally every script in your terminal could read clipboard and some terminal apps are disabling it by default(xterm,tmux). As for `OSC 7`, just imagine some script or shell will change your directory and you open a new window. I always want for all windows to have the same working directory and if something will arbitrary change it, I'll get annoyed. It's also strange in a context of `ssh`, so I just don't want to have `OSC 7`.

I don't mind `OSC 52`, but I don't want  `OSC 7`.
Also, this is just an example of some `OSC`, there're tons of them and some of them are really strange, like the one that could resize a window.
The issue is inspired by this `xterm` thing and some settings related to restricting of escapes in it https://invisible-island.net/xterm/manpage/xterm.html#VT100-Widget-Resources:allowWindowOps.

I don't see much issue with any of the points raised in that issue.

Though allowing users to opt-out would still be nice of course. But I don't see any reason why it would be made opt-in.

issue.title: Alacritty should provide option to completely turn off icon bouncing.
issue.body:
**Which operating system does the issue occur on?**
OS X

**If on linux, are you using X11 or Wayland?**
(n/a)

**Description**
This is somewhat related to #2492 but I think this is more Alacritty's job to provide a knob to turn off any kind of notification altogether. Think of this as having apps requesting your permission to send you notifications. Alacritty shouldn't just let any shell program cause the icon to bounce, it should be the one in-control (and thus let the user choose).

It is quite annoying to have to configure and re-configure each piece of software to handle signals correctly every time I re-install it or move between OSes/shells.

Something like this would be perfect:

```yaml
bell:
  enabled: false
  visual_bell:
    # maybe move visual bell option here?
```

issue.title: programs run inside alacritty can spy on clipboard
issue.body:
First of all, thanks for Alacritty. It is awesome. 

Alacritty implements OSC 52 completely, which gives clipboard_load access. This is really bad for sandboxing and containers. 
To test this try `printf '\e]52;c;?\a'`

IMO clipboard_load should be disabled by default, And should be gated with config setting.

I have attached a patch that disables clipboard_load completely. 

[deny-clipboard_load.patch.txt](https://github.com/alacritty/alacritty/files/11714223/deny-clipboard_load.patch.txt)

issue.title: add allow_clipboard config to not handle OSC 52
Add `terminal` config section to control OSCs
issue.body:
Some environments demand certain OSC sequences to be disabled or some escape sequence could require handling which is out of scope of alacritty, but could be done by external script (OSC 777).

Added section for now just handles the `OSC 52` sequence and changes its default to be `OnlyCopy`, which is handy for remote copy, but `Paste` is redundant because normal `Paste` hotkey could be used as well.

Fixes #3386.
